Part2

Class SinglyLinkedList

  • java.lang.Object
    • Part2.SinglyLinkedList

  • public class SinglyLinkedList
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has the implementation logic for both singly linked list and its node.

      • main

        Parameters:

      • insertAtEnd

        public void insertAtEnd(java.math.BigInteger b)
        Adds a node to the end of the list. This node contains the BigInteger data b as its data
        Parameters:
        b - Assumption: If this method is called in a brand new list (with head and tail=null), this will just add the node like a normal node. It does not require the list to be already populated. postcondition If this method is called on a brand new list with head and tail null, a new node is added to the list BigTheta No case: Big-Theta (1)

      • countNodes

        public int countNodes()
        Counts the number of nodes in the list. A full traversal of the list is required for this action
        Returns:
        count of the number of nodes in the singly linked list between head and tail, both inclusive precondition Size of the list is less than INTEGER.MAXVALUE and there should not be any loops in the list postcondition No change or alteration is made to the list while traversing. Just a count is maintained. BigTheta No Case: Big Theta(n)

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Method to check if list is empty or not
        Returns:
        true if the list empty false otherwise BigTheta Big Theta(1)

      • reverse

        public void reverse()
        Reverses the list precondition List is not recursive and does not contain any loops postcondition The current list is now reversed. a -> b -> c becomes c -> b -> a BigTheta Big Theta(n)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
